content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very well thought out ! ;)
I like this Clash ! The test cases and the description are good.
Well done !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Clearly defined puzzle. Statement is clear. Test Cases are easy to understand. Good puzzle for upper/lower usage

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This contribution is very well thought out, the statement is clear, and the test-cases are good.

Good Job Luke, Hope this gets fully approved!
Code-Parser.

Goal
* Please add "." after every sentence.

* Please change "have a sentence" to "are given a string".

* Please change "in the power" to "letters raised to the power of".

* Please add "letters" at the end of the second sentence.

* Please add "Spaces, digits and any other characters should be ignored".

Output
* Please change "power" to "letters raised to the power of".

* Please add "letters" at the end to the description.

Constraints
* Please delete the constraint. It is part of the explanation, not a constraint on what cases to expect.

Thanks.
It looks "I want to know the result of the number of uppercase in the power of the number of lowercase." is better, mate!
Don't hesitate to give advice and tell me if there are any syntax errors (I'm a French programmer)  !

Hi Luke, I tried your clash just now.

First of all, it's quite good... the statement is clear.

Secondly, why have you put this contribution up twice?

Third, I would suggest changing some validators and tests to include different Input Sentences.

You've just written "Hello world" in most of them. Perhaps change Input 2 to "Clash OF Code" or something... You should try to cover more possible inputs.
Maybe introduce more numbers, spaces and symbols into the Tests.
Otherwise it is quite easy.

Still, Good job. 
Code-Parser.

I listened to your advice, thank you for your contribution
Have a nice day !

To add to @5DN1L's advice, I suggest putting input length as a constraint.

For Example:
                                3 < the length of [[s]] < 20

This would make it clearer for the Coders that the string is less than 20 characters long. But you can change the max value to the maximum length of your longest input.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Some of his advice seems... weird. Hey @5DN1L, are you sure that you understand Luke's contribution? Why add letters at the end of the output?
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Anyway, Good luck.
What's wrong with adding the word "letters" to the end so that it reads "the number of lowercase letters"?

Hello 5DN1L, sorry. I'm just confused as to why the output should have the word "letters" added to it.

Input                                   Output
HELLO world                      3125 "letters"

If I'm not wrong, this is one of the suggestions you made at  Suggestion #7: Output.

Am I getting this muddled up again?
Thanks, Code-Parser.
It's just the same matter as my suggestion for point 4 in Goal section.

Oh... well that explains it.

I'm very sorry. I thought you were suggesting something else entirely!

Apologies, Code-Parser.
No worries. Would you please edit your earlier message with the "---------" thing and shorten that? It seems to cause display issues in the comment section.
Ok, sorry. I understand your suggestions now. Fixed that.
Thank you for your precious help you two :)

Thank you. One fix hasn't been made:

Goal
* Please change "in the power" to "letters raised to the power of".

Thanks again.
Also, it seems that it's too difficult to guess the requirement in Reverse mode. Maybe disable it?

Hey Luke. No problem, happy to help out.

I agree with 5DN1L on the Reverse mode. 
Your contribution looks very good now.

Whenever you are finished fixing your CoC, I will happily approve it.

All the best, Code-Parser.

Hey mate !
I accidentally created it twice, i just deleted the other one.
You're right, I changed the tests and try to cover more cases like sentences with @, ! and other things. Do you think it's ok now ?
Thank you very much for your feedback, tell me if you see other things to improve.

Looking much better.

@5DN1L has posted some advice at the top of the page.


His advice is good, and maybe you should take a look at it.
His advice helped me create a CoC. (Just validated "Yay!")

Anyway Happy Coding, Code-Parser.
